programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Duke/North Carolina winner goes up against the Louisville/Clemson winner in the ACC Tournament championship for an automatic NCAA Tournament berth; NC State won the title last year, defeating North Carolina in the final, 84-76, behind D.J. Burns.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: New Jersey has a three-game winning streak after beating Edmonton, 3-2, and the Devils have won their last two meetings with the Penguins, including a 3-2 shootout victory on Feb. 4; Pittsburgh has a three-game winnings streak and is 16-13-5 at home.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: St. John's/Marquette winner goes up against the Creighton/UConn winner in the Big East Tournament championship game for an automatic NCAA Tournament berth; UConn won the title last year, defeating Marquette in the final, 73-57, behind Tristen Newton.

programme.title: Destined to Drive: Patrick Dempsey's Return to Racing
Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Utah claimed a 197.300-196.975 victory over UCLA in their lone meeting of the 2024 season on Feb. 19, 2024, after going down .425 at the midway point after bars and beam; Makenna Smith posted an event-high 9.900 on bars in the win on the road.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Minnesota claimed victories over Kansas City in all three of their meetings from the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on Sept. 21 with a 2-0 scoreline; Kelvin Yeboah and Bongokuhle Hlongwane found the net from a pair of Robin Lod assists.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Christopher Bell made it three-straight wins following his victory at Phoenix over Denny Hamlin, while William Byron leads the points standings; Kyle Larson and Joey Logano won the two races at Las Vegas last year over Tyler Reddick and Bell.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in fourth event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brooks Koepka won the individual crown with a two-stroke victory over Cameron Smith and Marc Leishman, while Rippers GC took home the team title in last year's edition.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Pickleball
programme.desc: The stars of the game battle for a title and PPA Rankings points as the sport's top athletes compete at one of the most prestigious tournaments, inspiring the next generation of fans and players.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: St. John's/Marquette winner goes up against the Creighton/UConn winner in the Big East Tournament championship game for an automatic NCAA Tournament berth; UConn won the title last year, defeating Marquette in the final, 73-57, behind Tristen Newton.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in fourth event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brooks Koepka won the individual crown with a two-stroke victory over Cameron Smith and Marc Leishman, while Rippers GC took home the team title in last year's edition.

programme.title: Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Utah claimed a 197.300-196.975 victory over UCLA in their lone meeting of the 2024 season on Feb. 19, 2024, after going down .425 at the midway point after bars and beam; Makenna Smith posted an event-high 9.900 on bars in the win on the road.

programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Austin and Los Angeles played to a 1-1 draw in their final meeting of the 2024 season on Sept. 18, which saw LAFC's David Martínez Morales equalize in the second half; Jader Obrian had given Austin a 1-0 lead in first half stoppage time.

programme.title: Motoamerica King of the Baggers Rewind
America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Kyle Busch secured his 67th career Truck Series win with his victory at Atlanta over Stewart Friesen, while Grant Enfinger leads the standings; Rajah Caruth averaged 129.91 mph en route to his win at Las Vegas last year over Tyler Ankrum.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Seventy-two of the world's top bowlers compete for a $200,000 purse with the winner taking home $30,000; E.J. Tackett, the three-time Chris Schenkel PBA Player of the Year (2016, 2023-24) is the only bowler with two victories this season.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: GWS (1-0-0) has won three of the past four meetings with the Demons, including an 85-83 victory on July 27, as Jesse Hogan and Toby Greene combined for seven goals; Melbourne (0-0-0) finished 14th out of 18 clubs in 2024 with 11 wins and 12 losses.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez opened the season with a dominant victory at Thailand to gain an early eight-point lead over his brother, Alex Marquez; Marco Bezzecchi won the last race at Argentina in 2023 over Johann Zarco.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Los Angeles and Portland split victories in their two meetings from the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on Sept. 18 with a 4-2 scoreline; Evander found the net with a brace for the Timbers after 51 minutes in the win at home.

programme.desc: Jorge Martin moved into first place and gained an 18-point lead over Brad Binder after winning the race at Portugal over Enea Bastianini for his first victory of the season; Alex Rins won the race at Texas last year over Luca Marini.
